      • prepend

        public static <E> java.util.List<E> prepend(E head,
                                            java.util.List<E> tail)

        Prepends the head item before the tail list.

        The following fragment is always true: x.equals(prepend(head(x),tail(x)))

        Parameters:
        head - The new first item
        tail - The tail after the first item
        Returns:
        Returns an unmodifiable view on the lists

      • append

        public static <E> java.util.List<E> append(java.util.List<E> init,
                                           E last)

        Appends the last item after the init list.

        The following fragment is always true: x.equals(append(init(x),last(x)))

        Parameters:
        init - The init before the last item
        last - The new last item
        Returns:
        Returns an unmodifiable view on the lists

      • concatenate

        public static <E> java.util.List<E> concatenate(java.util.List<? extends E> first,
                                                java.util.List<? extends E> second)

        Persistent concatenation of the lists.

        The following fragment is always true: x.equals(concatenate(x.subList(0,n),x.subList(n,x.size()))

        Parameters:
        first - The first list
        second - The second list
        Returns:
        Returns an unmodifiable view on the lists
